alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 5:38PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, Currituck, and northern Chowan Counties and the eastern City of Virginia Beach through 630 PM EST... At 537 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers extending from near Princess Anne to near Currituck to near Belvidere. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Currituck, Moyock and Princess Anne around 540 PM EST. Knotts Island around 550 PM EST. Elizabeth City State University, Nixonton and Corolla around 600 PM EST. Weeksville around 605 PM EST. Old Trap around 615 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Rudee Heights, Poplar Branch, Spot, Parkville, Pungo, Jacocks, Beach Springs, Smithtown, Spences Corner and Goose Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
